summary:
{
  "summary": "BaseDataLayer serves as a generic repository that encapsulates all persistence operations for core domain entities such as elements, steps, users, threads, and feedback. It offers standardized methods for creating, retrieving, updating, deleting, listing, and upserting records, as well as a utility for constructing debug URLs.",
  "business_intent": "Provide a single, reusable abstraction over the underlying storage mechanism so that application logic can perform data operations without coupling to specific database APIs, ensuring consistency, testability, and easier maintenance.",
  "keywords": [
    "data access",
    "repository pattern",
    "CRUD operations",
    "entity persistence",
    "upsert",
    "debug URL generation",
    "thread management",
    "user management",
    "feedback handling",
    "step tracking",
    "element storage",
    "abstraction layer"
  ]
}
}
